definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Throughout the research, all the four hypotheses raised at the beginning will have been gradually proved.
sentences.chinese: 研究完成后，篇首所提出的四条假设将逐一获证。

sentences.english: The exercises are numbered from 1 to 365.
sentences.chinese: 练习从一至三百六十五逐一编号。

sentences.english: And you'd have to kind of weed out who's singing what in the harmonies.
sentences.chinese: 于是你就感觉要逐一细听是谁在唱哪个和声。

sentences.english: He told her parents that the girl had a noble fate and a very promising future.
sentences.chinese: 甄夫人非常相信，请他逐一为自己儿女看相算命。

sentences.english: We were so amazed and looked at the paintings one by one.
sentences.chinese: 我们万分惊叹，逐一仔细观看那些名画。

sentences.english: This article guides you through these steps, one by one.
sentences.chinese: 本文带领您逐一执行这些步骤。

sentences.english: He talked about all those points in  descending  order of importance.
sentences.chinese: 他对那几点按其重要性逐一谈了他的意见。

sentences.english: HereI will spread and share my traveling experiences one by one with you.
sentences.chinese: 这里且将我平生的游历逐一道来，与诸君共享。

sentences.english: No, it’s just a less effective method than single-changing.
sentences.chinese: 不，其实只是那种方法没有“逐一改变”这么有效果。

sentences.english: Check their names off (the list) as the students arrive.
sentences.chinese: 学生到时逐一在名单上打钩。

sentences.english: The blend treated mechanically was extracted by xylon and aceton one by one.
sentences.chinese: 经过力化学处理过的混合物用二甲苯和丙酮逐一浸取。

sentences.english: In July, Mandi 's collection including seventeen paintings will show you the spirit of contract.
sentences.chinese: 七月，契约之展，由壹霖的这十七幅作品逐一呈现。

sentences.english: Sometimes up to 30 dolls can be combined inside the biggest doll.
sentences.chinese: 有时多达30个玩偶都能被逐一套入最大的玩偶里。

sentences.english: The employees were asked to detail their complains and grievances.
sentences.chinese: 要求雇员们逐一说明他们的怨言和苦情。

sentences.english: The speaker explained these questions one by one.
sentences.chinese: 报告人对这些问题逐一作了说明。

sentences.english: Comparing something head-to-head with a pre-determined standard to ascertain success or failure.
sentences.chinese: 将某件事与原告制定的标准逐一对比，论成败高下。

definition: to lump together/to treat along with all the others
variant of 一併|一并, to lump together/to treat along with all the others
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to advance/to conduct/underway/in progress/to do/to carry out/to carry on/to execute

in addition/moreover/(used before a disyllabic verb to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
thorough and detailed/exhaustive/the tedious details in full
summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report/also written 匯總|汇总
summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report
